intro: Myrobalanus sericea, commonly known as silver mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhizophoraceae. It is native to coastal regions of Southeast Asia, including India, Indonesia, and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its smooth, silver-gray bark and its ability to thrive in saline and waterlogged soils. It has aerial roots that help it anchor in soft, muddy substrates. Myrobalanus sericea plays an important role in stabilizing shorelines and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
